g.text: Which country's embassy was mentioned: France, U.S., Mexico, CanadaThread A1.US Embassy in Haiti urges Americans to remain sheltered in place amid violence.The State Department on Sunday encouraged U.S. citizens in Haiti to shelter in place amid ongoing violent protests near Port au Prince.2.State Department advises Americans in Haiti to avoid airport amid unrest.The State Department on Tuesday warned U.S. citizens to avoid the international airport in Haiti's capital of Port-au-Prince amid continuing political unrest.3.US Embassy in Haiti requests more Marines, security personnel amid violence.4.US missionaries fear for lives amid riots in Haiti. The capital of Haiti has faced four days of riots and demonstrations â€”forcing US tourists and missionaries to stay inside following a government-ordered.Thread BHaiti protests carry on despite fuel hike U-turn; flights canceled.Haitian leaders pleaded for calm on Saturday as violent protests over fuel price increases entered a second day and U.S. airlines canceled flights to the Caribbean nation.1.US Embassy in Haiti urges Americans to remain sheltered in place amid violence.The State Department on Sunday encouraged U.S. citizens in Haiti to shelter in place amid ongoing violent protests near Port au Prince.1.1. State Department advises Americans in Haiti to avoid airport amid unrest.The State Department on Tuesday warned U.S. citizens to avoid the international airport in Haiti's capital of Port-au-Prince amid continuing political unrest.1.1.1.US Embassy in Haiti requests more Marines, security personnel amid violence.
